Reviews.Title: “An unfortunate experience”
Reviews.Author: Bernadette W
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via a travel agent for 2 days prior to our cruise and two days post the cruise on September 17th and 18th and October 3rd and 4th. When we arrived at the hotel, we were given keys to 4 different rooms which were all occupied. When he was advised that rooms were occupied, he became belligerent..He was clueless, confused and disrespectful. When we finally got our room, it had an awful smell, there was no hot water, needless to say after a long trip we had to take a freezing shower - Not impressed. On our return on October 3rd, we were given a different room and it was a lot better. No Smell . Location is excellent. Accesible to banks, stores, and main tourists attractions ie. Vatican, St. Peter's Square. Spanish Steps was also accesible by reasonable taxi costs approximately 8 euros. However, would not recommend this hotel to anyone. There are other great hotels within the same proximity. The only redeemable feature in this fiasco is the staff Angela, friendly, accommdating and respectful.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in a ok place but be careful”
Reviews.Author: Dorothy_Finland
Reviews.Content: We spend here four nights and at the first night I woke up when someone was going to come in to our room. Then the voices stopped. My heart was going fast. Then someone new tried to come to our room with a key and even got the door open. We run to the door and yelled that we were staying here. Then the peole went away. We guessed that the receptionist had give this hotelroom to other couple as well and they tried to get in first. When they could not do this they went to get the receptionist who used some spare key to get in. We didn't get any explanation to this, but we were on our toes the next night. All in all, I would visit this hotel never again, allthough it is quite near the Vatican and a little walk or metrotrip from the city. Rome is beautiful city and has lots to see.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: olmalk
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is good, one block from the city metro. Rooms are very basic, not decorated at all. When we arrived at the hotel we got 401 room which smelled awful ,we asked receptionist to change and she put us in another room 308.This room was clean, not smelled and spacious. Staff was nice and helpful. Buffet style breakfast is not extremely varied, but OK.

Reviews.Title: “Just average perfect”
Reviews.Author: E_Seals
Reviews.Content: As i said above - it was perfectly in the middle! Staff was great and nice, place was also amazing. Room was...erm..just ok.nothing bad to say, but also nothing to remember. A perfect, not-very-expensive-option for someone whos booking was cancelled :) 10-15minutes walk from St Peter Square. Ladies serving breatfasts are very nice, especially when you're the one waiting before seven o'clock in the morning to start your RomeTrip as early as possible!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value, good location, clean, friendly”
Reviews.Author: amosy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights with my spouse on holiday. Room was clean and functional, although far from fancy. Location is good. It's not in the the historic center of Rome where most of the sights are, but it's a ten minute walk there. It's a block away from metro and bus stations. We enjoyed walking to most of the places we wanted to see. Rooms were basic yet very clean. Staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast basic yet completely satisfying for us. Altogether we definitely enjoyed this hotel and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “An exellent hotel to stay in when in rome”
Reviews.Author: Eyal S
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. Its location is very good because it is A 10min walk away from the vatican and from the main atractions in rome. we stayed for 4 nights and had to use public transportation only for one day. the hotel is very clean, the staff is very helpfull and welcoming. we strongly recomend this hotel, it is realy worth the monney.

Reviews.Title: “Good no frills hotel in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: AviEli
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during a rainy week in Rome, so we really appreciated the proximity to the Metro station (2 mins walk) on Line A, and also to the bus stop. Hotel staff was very friendly, helpful and front desk staff had good English. Room was large and clean and bed had great mattress and pillows (better than in some 5 star hotels I've been to). Liked least: Breakfast was a bit boring but adequate quantities Shower partition could be redone so water wouldn't leak all over the bathroom floor. We read what others wrote about the noise from the elevator so we asked (and got) a room far from it and slept like a log.

Reviews.Title: “CONVIENIENT, INEXPENSIVE, FRIENDLY”
Reviews.Author: lizzard1
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights next to the elevator, didn't hear it once, Staff were extremely pleasant and helpful, even with a bit of a language barrier. If you want all the frills, this one is not for you but if you want a clean, comfortable place to stay, this is the place at a third of the cost of the big name hotels. Close to the subway, so nothing is very far, and you can walk to the Vatican. Only breakfast is available here, but there are many outdoor/indoor restaurants close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad.....”
Reviews.Author: CJMVancouver
Reviews.Content: The location was good if you want to be on that side of the city....close to the Vatican....but everything else is across the river and a rather long walk. The hotel staff for the most part were excellent! The first night we got in (at nearly midnight) the guy was not the nicest in the world...kinda rude actually....but everyone else was awesome....they recommended restaurants, gave us directions....they were great! Cleanliness.....it could be improved upon....let's say that may be one area they need to work on. The breakfast was great! Excellent coffee, lots of pastries, meats and cheeses and bread. Breakfast was probably one of the best on our one month trip! Probably wouldn't return to this hotel just based on the cleanliness factor.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place in an excellent location...”
Reviews.Author: renik20
Reviews.Content: We were advised of this hotel by a travel agent - and we're glad we were! It's a simple, family-run hotel that was quiet, quaint, and exTREMEly convenient. For the price, you get a powerful A/C, simple breakfast, 24 hour front desk, and an amazing location in central Rome. We were able to walk to the Vatican, Piazza del Popolo, Piazza del Spagna, la Fontana di Trevi, the Vatican, and if we had wanted to walk a half hour, the Colosseum. If you're not up for walking, there's a Metro station around the block, and you're at Roma Termini (Central Train/Metro station) in six stops. Some of the better reasonable shopping is on Cola di Rienzo, about two minutes south, or you can walk to Via Condotti, where you'll find designer heaven (Prada, Ferragamo, Dior, etc.) There's also a fabulous little restaurant around the corner on Via Giulio Cesare (two blocks west) called L'Aquila D'Oro, which had a very reasonable all-inclusive menu and amazing food. (Try the Tagliatelle del fiore!) There's also a street market around the Castell' Sant'Angelo a few blocks south that stays open late in the evenings - we wandered around the booths until 3am one night! We were able to walk to the Vatican, Piazza del Popolo, Piazza del Spagna, la Fontana di Trevi, the Vatican, and if we had wanted to walk a half hour, the Colosseum. If you're not up for walking, there's a Metro station around the block, and you're at Roma Termini (Central Train/Metro station) in six stops. For the value, you get a nice clean room and friendly staff. If you're expecting five-star perks, look elsewhere, but who goes to Rome to stay in their hotel room all day anyway?!?

Reviews.Title: “Simple hotel with sympathetic staff”
Reviews.Author: Ilana_31
Reviews.Content: Very simple hotel, with a simple but tasty breakfast. It's clean, with a sympathetic staff. But we slept at a room close to the lift (that is very old and noisy), so late at night it was possible to hear the tremendous noise that it made. It's near to the metro (what is perfect!!!) - you can get everywhere by metro - better that taxi (Expensive and you don't wanna know Rome's traffic!). I would return to this hotel, but would ask to stay at a room far from the lift!!!

Reviews.Title: “it's just good but without basic providings”
Reviews.Author: alexiaThessaloniki
Reviews.Content: The hotel was less worse than my expectations.The worst thing of all was the sound-insulation.We was hearing everything from the other rooms!!Fortunatelly we was very exhausted from the all-day walks so it didn't make our sleep so difficult.The staff -althought it was very helpful-don't speak english as a result our understanding was problematic..The breakfast was just satifactory.After taking a bath, the bathroom was overflow!There wasn't refrigerator in the room!However the bed and the pillows were more comfortable!The advantage of hotel is its location.It's near the metro station (Lepanto) and from there you can go everywhere in a few minutes and Vaticano was only10-15 minutes away by foot.I belive that this hotel would be a good choice for young people who come for the first time to Rome because you spend the most of your time walking around the city so you don't need many comforts from your hotel.It was

Reviews.Title: “San Valentino is more than adequate and a great price”
Reviews.Author: murphyBcCanada
Reviews.Content: We were 2 Canadian women who stayed at the San Valentino for only one night before joining our cruise ship. The location was excellant for some sightseeing and shopping. The front desk staff were very helpful and friendly. Others in our group stayed there 3or4 nights and thought it great too. The hotel had provision to store luggage while waiting for our transits. The breakfast was excellant and just what we had expected which was nice. We would recommend this hotel for its location, reasonable price, cleanliness and friendly staff as well as good capucinno. Carol, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Poor value for money”
Reviews.Author: Maryjane30
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a 10 minute walk from Piazza De Popolo and an additional 5 minute walk from Piazza de Spagna, so the hotel location is good. Metro station Flamini is in the near proximity of the hotel (just a 2 minute walk). Staff is friendly. The hotel rooms are simply furnished, small but clean. The standard double room does'nt have a mini bar, terrace and enough wardrobe space. The bathroom is very small. There is a small, but functional elevator in the hotel. The rooms are not sound proof, so you’re destined to hear every door knob turning or footstep in the corridor as well as street noise.Air conditioning has to be paid additionally. Breakfast is far from satisfactory. There is a choice between two kinds of ham, some cheese, bread, butter, marmalade and some sweet pastry. Everything is fresh, though . Quality/price ratio is far from realistic taking into consideration the quality of rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time!”
Reviews.Author: Reillysroost
Reviews.Content: Wonderful staff, clean rooms, and great breakfast. It is not fancy according to American standards but it was a perfect place to be while in Rome. We loved the street view from our window. There was very little traffic noise. We were on the 4th floor and there was a noisy water pump that ran one floor up so you might be better off a floor or two down. This hotel is very convient to the Metro. I have included a couple of pictures from our window.

Reviews.Title: “quiet yet convenient location, excellent value for money, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: corletto
Reviews.Content: we arrived in Rome by car from florence very hot and tired at 2pm in the afternoon with no hotel booked. found this hotel by accident.excellent value for money. we paid 90 euros - breakfast inc - for a double room ( we got a quadruple room ) metro on the corner 5 stops to Roma Termini (10 mins) the main rail station where everything is within walking distance. we managed to walk it home from spanish steps etc. took about 30 mins. not fancy but clean, comfortable, quiet and ideally located if you'd rather exchange a little walk for a bit of peace and quiet when it's time to go to bed. staff are sooo friendly. buffett breakfast. loads of choice. would definately return. for the money would rate it 100%. ps parking is a night mare in Rome and even the best hotels often don't have parking. you can park right outside the door. 8am to 8pm 1 euro per hr. 8pm to 8am free. for Rome this is fantastic.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel San Valentino
HotelInfo.Address: Via Ezio, 55, 00192 Rome, Italy
